event.title: a rise in A(H1N1) and malaria during recent weeks

data.event: This occurrence is part of a rise in A(H1N1) and malaria during recent weeks in two provinces, as was the confirmation of twenty cases of malaria in Zambales.
Officials from the Department of Health say that they are not surprised, as A(H1N1) cases began to appear at about the same time last year, coinciding with the onset of the local flu season.

event.title: look at the pattern for this month

data.event: "If we look at the pattern for this month, it was also the same time last year when cases of A(H1N1) started increasing," says Dr. Lyndon Lee Suy, "As it is, it is flu season already."
"If we look at the pattern for this month, it was also the same time last year when cases of A(H1N1) started increasing," says Dr. Lyndon Lee Suy, "As it is, it is flu season already."

event.title: their first case of A(H1N1) in May 2009

data.event: The Philippines reported their first case of A(H1N1) in May 2009 in a ten-year-old child from the United States.
